sourceMeaningMnemonic: The <radical>flowers</radical> are being worked upon by a <radical>tsunami</radical> with a <radical>drop</radical> <radical>specialty</radical>: this tsunami can <kanji>dilute</kanji> flowers with just one tsunami-powered drop of itself. That’s its specialty.
meaningInfo: Look at the flowers as the tsunami begins to dilute them with just one drop. Their color and fragrance and dimensions become weaker and more spread out. It’s really trippy to witness.
readingMnemonic: You watch the flowers become <kanji>dilute</kanji>d with just one drop, and realize that this is a nature <reading>hack</reading> (<ja>はく</ja>). You’ve never seen anything like this before, so you think the tsunami found out how to hack nature and that’s how it got so good at diluting things. By hacking nature.
readingInfo: As you continue to watch the tsunami's drop of water dilute the flowers, imagine what techniques this tsunami is using to hack nature. Is the tsunami a sinister being from the future? Maybe.
